intro: Anelasma minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered anelasma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, arranged alternately along the stem. Anelasma minutiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
